info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 7:51AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...AN AREA OF MODERATE SNOW WILL AFFECT EAST CENTRAL JEFFERSON... BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN INDIANA...SOUTHERN BUTLER...NORTHERN ALLEGHENY...SOUTHERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...ARMSTRONG...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 749 AM EST, a band of moderate snow was located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Ford City to Toronto. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Weirton, Steubenville, Butler, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Punxsutawney, and Monaca. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 16 and 48. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 64 and 91. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 36 and 57. Visibilities will drop quickly to a half-mile or less in this area of moderate snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
